projectPurpose: To provide a Rust-based fullstack application framework for building user interfaces and applications across web, desktop, mobile, and server platforms from a single codebase, emphasizing a familiar development experience, type safety, performance, and direct system access.
mainFeatures: Fullstack capabilities (web, desktop, mobile, server, and more) from a single codebase
Ergonomic state management (inspired by React, Solid, Svelte)
Type-safe Routing and server functions leveraging Rust's compile-time guarantees
Integrated bundler for deploying to web, macOS, Linux, and Windows
React-like mental model and API surface
Leverages HTML and CSS for UI definition and styling
Renderer-agnostic VirtualDOM for portability
Hot-reloading for fast development cycles
Direct access to system APIs
Support for modern web features like SSR, Hydration, and HTML streaming
Designed for high performance

mainFeatures: Uses Rust backend with web frontend (HTML, CSS, JS/TS)

Security-focused with permissions and sandboxing
Cross-platform bundling and distribution
Plugin system for accessing native features

marketPositioning: Dioxus is positioned as a modern, performant, and type-safe fullstack application framework within the Rust ecosystem. It differentiates itself by enabling developers to build user interfaces and entire applications for web, desktop, mobile, and server targets from a single *Rust* codebase, offering a React-like development experience but with the inherent benefits of Rust, such as performance, memory safety, and strong type checking across the full stack. While competing with established multi-platform frameworks like Flutter (Dart), React Native (JavaScript), and web-based solutions like Electron and Tauri, Dioxus targets developers who prioritize a pure Rust development environment and seek a unified language for all layers of their application, from UI to backend services, aiming for potentially smaller binaries and higher performance than frameworks embedding full browser engines.
